General Corrosion.unacceptable:
1. Prevent scaling through adjusting the index by 
a. Increasing the saturation pH (e.g. by reducing alkalinity) or 
b. By decreasing the pH (through acid addition), or 
c. By decreasing CaCO3 concentration by diluting the stream  (through reducing concentration cycles, if applicable) and adjusting pH, or by removing calcium (softening - chemical, ion exchange or nano-filtration) or alkalinity (de-alkalation through acidification, chemical porecipitation, nono-filtration) or both.
2. Combat scaling by employing scale inhibitors.
General Corrosion.acceptable: Maintain monitoring, and be ready to take action should index increase.
General Corrosion.tolerable:
1. Prevent scaling through adjusting the index by 
a. Increasing the saturation pH (e.g. by reducing alkalinity) or 
b. Decreasing the pH (through acid addition), or 
c. Decreasing CaCO3 concentration by diluting the stream  (through reducing concentration cycles, if applicable) and adjusting pH, or by removing calcium (softening - chemical, ion exchange or nano-filtration) or alkalinity (de-alkalation through acidification, chemical porecipitation, nono-filtration) or both.
2. Combat scaling by employing scale inhibitors.

suspended solids.unacceptable: Prevent fouling by removing suspended solids (through gravity settling, hydrocloning, media filtration or membrane filtration).
suspended solids.tolerable:
a. Prevent fouling by removing suspended solids (through media filtration or membrane filtration).
b. Combat foling by addition of dispersant
